166,,Manage Supporting References,Header for Page 166
166,Manage Supporting References,Supporting References,Header for Page 166
166,Manage Supporting References
column2: Supporting References,Supporting references are used to store additional source information about a subledger journal entry at the line level.,Header for Page 166

column1: 166,Manage Supporting References
column2: Supporting References,"Supporting references are a powerful tool to capture transaction attributes in journal lines. You can use these tags to report on entries, reconcile entries back to source systems, or even maintain balances at the attribute level.",Header for Page 166

column1: 166,Manage Supporting References
column2: Supporting References,Define supporting references once and reuse by assigning sources of different event classes or source systems to the same supporting reference.,Header for Page 166

column1: 166,Manage Supporting References
column2: Supporting References,"You can link one source per event class to each supporting reference. The subledger or source system uses the supporting reference name to store the source values. This standardizes supporting reference information, even if it comes from disparate source systems.",Header for Page 166

column1: 166,Manage Supporting References
column2: Supporting References,Supporting references can be defined using either of these options (located on tabs):,Header for Page 166

column1: 166,Manage Supporting References

166,Manage Supporting References,"Select the With Balances tab in the supporting reference definition to have balances maintained when the supporting reference is associated. For balance sheet accounts, supporting reference balances are carried forward to the first period of the accounting calendar's year. For Profit and Loss accounts, supporting reference balances are set to zero in the first period of the accounting calendar's year. A limit of thirty supporting references with balances can be defined. You can consider adding more source assignments to predefined supporting references, rather than creating a new one.",Header for Page 166
166,"Manage Supporting References
column2: Select the With Balances tab in the supporting reference definition to have balances maintained when the supporting reference is associated. For balance sheet accounts, supporting reference balances are carried forward to the first period of the accounting calendar's year. For Profit and Loss accounts, supporting reference balances are set to zero in the first period of the accounting calendar's year. A limit of thirty supporting references with balances can be defined. You can consider adding more source assignments to predefined supporting references, rather than creating a new one.",Supporting references with balances establish subledger balances for a particular source and account for a particular combination of supporting references plus the account combination.,Header for Page 166

column1: 166,"Manage Supporting References
column2: Select the With Balances tab in the supporting reference definition to have balances maintained when the supporting reference is associated. For balance sheet accounts, supporting reference balances are carried forward to the first period of the accounting calendar's year. For Profit and Loss accounts, supporting reference balances are set to zero in the first period of the accounting calendar's year. A limit of thirty supporting references with balances can be defined. You can consider adding more source assignments to predefined supporting references, rather than creating a new one.",For example:,Header for Page 166

column1: 166,Manage Supporting References,"If a journal line contains a supporting reference that includes two sources, Customer Type and Customer Name. Balances are created for the account combination, plus customer name and customer type.",Header for Page 166
166,"Manage Supporting References
column2: If a journal line contains a supporting reference that includes two sources, Customer Type and Customer Name. Balances are created for the account combination, plus customer name and customer type.",Without Balances:,Header for Page 166

column1: 166,Manage Supporting References,You can assign up to 30 SR without balance to each journal line. Consider using a journal entry header or line description if:,Header for Page 166
166,Manage Supporting References
column2: You can assign up to 30 SR without balance to each journal line. Consider using a journal entry header or line description if:,- No balance is maintained for a supporting reference. - No supporting reference details are needed for reports.,Header for Page 166

167,Create Supporting References,1. Navigate to the Manage Supporting References page. 2. Click the With Balances tab. 3. Click Create icon. 4. Enter Name . 5. Enter Short Name . 6. In the Sources region:,Header for Page 167

167,Assign Supporting References,"1. On the Manage Supporting References page, navigate to the Assignments tab. 2. Click on the Add Assignments button. 3. In the Select Scope pop-up window, select the Subledger Application and Event Class to limit the scope for which supporting references are to be assigned. 4. In the new pop-up window, select the associated supporting references and the configured journal line rules. 5. Click save to assign the supporting references to the selected journal line rules.",Header for Page 167

172,,Chapter 6 Accounting Transformation,Header for Page 172
172,,How Subledger Journal Entries Are Created and Processed in Accounting Hub,Header for Page 172

172,How Subledger Journal Entries Are Created and Processed in Accounting Hub,1. The source system transactions are uploaded into Universal Content Management. 2. The transactions are then imported into Accounting Hub using the Import Accounting Transactions process. 3. The Create Accounting process is automatically submitted. 4. Subledger journal entry rule set definitions and sources from transaction data are applied to create subledger journal entries. 5. The subledger journal entries are summarized and imported to Oracle General Ledger.,Header for Page 172

173,,Why can't I assign some account rules to a rule set?,Header for Page 173

173,Why can't I assign some account rules to a rule set?,"You can only assign account rules to rule sets that use sources from the same subledger application. Review the account rule, its condition, and any mapping sets or user-defined formula it references, and verify that no sources from other applications are used.",Header for Page 173
173,,Can I delete a source that's no longer used in accounting rules?,Header for Page 173

173,Can I delete a source that's no longer used in accounting rules?,"No, you can't delete such a source. However, you can stop populating the corresponding field in the data template.",Header for Page 173
173,,How can I use a mapping set across subledger applications?,Header for Page 173

173,How can I use a mapping set across subledger applications?,"You can't use a mapping set across subledger applications. Instead, use the setup data export and import to replicate mapping set data across subledger applications.",Header for Page 173
173,How can I use a mapping set across subledger applications?,Related Topics,Header for Page 173

column1: 176,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 176
176,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 176
176,,Manually Upload Transaction Data,Header for Page 176
176,Manually Upload Transaction Data,"To upload the transaction data manually, follow these sequential steps:",Header for Page 176

176,Manually Upload Transaction Data,1. Download the transaction data template using the Manage Subledger Application task. 2. Save the file on a local drive. 3. Extract the three files contained in the downloaded template.,Header for Page 176
176,Manually Upload Transaction Data,a. Metadata.txt,Header for Page 176
176,Manually Upload Transaction Data,- The metadata file contains key information about the source system. b. XlaTrxH.csv,Header for Page 176

176,Manually Upload Transaction Data,- This file contains the header-level columns for the transaction data that can be populated. - The column names match the short name of the sources that were included in the Transaction Information worksheet during the registration of your source system. - One column that's available in the header and line file is the Transaction Number. The Transaction Number links the header and its corresponding lines information. c. XlaTrxL.csv,Header for Page 176

176,Manually Upload Transaction Data,- This file contains the line-level columns for the transaction data that can be populated. - The column names match the short name of the sources that were included in the Line Information worksheet during the registration of your source system. 4. Populate the header and line CSV files.,Header for Page 176

176,Manually Upload Transaction Data,"Note: Both XlaTrxH.csv and XlaTrxL.csv files may contain column names that aren't used by the subledger, such as Character9, Date2, Long Character1 and so on. You can leave the unused column blank when populating transaction data in these files.",Header for Page 176
176,Manually Upload Transaction Data,5. Select and compress the three files.,Header for Page 176

176,,"The file names must remain the same as the downloaded files. As a best practice, Oracle recommends that the .zip file has a unique name that includes a subledger source and date stamp. The .zip file must begin with XlaTransaction . We recommend you suffix the file with the subledger source name and date to identify the file uniquely. For example, XlaTransactionRetailLoan050417.zip.",Header for Page 176

176,"The file names must remain the same as the downloaded files. As a best practice, Oracle recommends that the .zip file has a unique name that includes a subledger source and date stamp. The .zip file must begin with XlaTransaction . We recommend you suffix the file with the subledger source name and date to identify the file uniquely. For example, XlaTransactionRetailLoan050417.zip.",168,Header for Page 176
177,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 177
177,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 177
177,,6. Upload the .zip file into Universal Content Management.,Header for Page 177

177,,"CAUTION: You must assign the Accounting Hub Integration Duty Role to a user-defined job role to perform this step. Also, you must ensure that the user is also assigned the General Accounting Manager job role. Otherwise, you must add the Upload Data for Accounting Hub Import role to the job role. Alternatively, you can assign the Subledger Accounting Duty and Subledger Accounting Reporting Duty roles to any of the following general ledger job roles:",Header for Page 177
177,,Chief Financial Officer Controller Financial Analyst General Accountant,Header for Page 177

177,,Navigate: Navigator > Tools > File Import and Export . Click Create. Browse for the compressed file. Select account: fin/fusion/AccountingHub/Import . Save and Close. View the file upload results in the Search Results region.,Header for Page 177

177,Navigate: Navigator > Tools > File Import and Export . Click Create. Browse for the compressed file. Select account: fin/fusion/AccountingHub/Import . Save and Close. View the file upload results in the Search Results region.,7. Submit the Import Accounting Transactions process.,Header for Page 177

177,,"Navigate: Navigator > Scheduled Processes . This process imports accounting transactions from Universal Content Management, creates accounting entries and posts the journal entries to the general ledger.",Header for Page 177

177,"Navigate: Navigator > Scheduled Processes . This process imports accounting transactions from Universal Content Management, creates accounting entries and posts the journal entries to the general ledger.","Optionally, you can choose to upload the transaction data to the interface tables, import transaction data from the interface tables, and create accounting as separate processes. To do this, you enable the Flexible Configuration of Accounting Hub Cloud Service feature. Refer to the Advanced Features for Importing Transaction Data to Accounting Hub topic for details.",Header for Page 177

177,"Navigate: Navigator > Scheduled Processes . This process imports accounting transactions from Universal Content Management, creates accounting entries and posts the journal entries to the general ledger.","If there are invalid entries, query journal entries with Invalid status from the Review Journal Entries task, view the transaction, and correct the errors directly. Refer to the Correct Accounting Hub Transaction Data for Invalid Entries topic for details.",Header for Page 177

177,"Navigate: Navigator > Scheduled Processes . This process imports accounting transactions from Universal Content Management, creates accounting entries and posts the journal entries to the general ledger.",Note: Error correction is dependent on the dependent on the Update Subledger Transactions (XLA_UPDATE_SUBLEDGER_TRANSACTIONS_PRIV) privilege. You can remove or add the privilege per your company's policy.,Header for Page 177

177,"Navigate: Navigator > Scheduled Processes . This process imports accounting transactions from Universal Content Management, creates accounting entries and posts the journal entries to the general ledger.","You can also run the Accounting Hub Maintenance process with the Purge invalid transactions mode to delete invalid transaction data along with the resulting invalid subledger journal entries, modify the data in CSV files and import them again. Refer to Accounting Hub Maintenance for more details.",Header for Page 177

177,"Navigate: Navigator > Scheduled Processes . This process imports accounting transactions from Universal Content Management, creates accounting entries and posts the journal entries to the general ledger.","By default, uploaded transaction data are kept in the Accounting Hub Cloud for 90 days. Transactions that are used to create multiperiod accounting entries are kept until the end date of the multiperiod duration. You can change the transaction retention period's duration to any value between 30 days and 458 days. To change the",Header for Page 177

177,"Navigate: Navigator > Scheduled Processes . This process imports accounting transactions from Universal Content Management, creates accounting entries and posts the journal entries to the general ledger.",169,Header for Page 177
178,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 178
178,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 178
178,,"accounting retention period, navigate to the Manage Subledger Accounting Lookups page, and specify a value for the ORA_XLA_AHC_RETENTION_DAYS lookup type.",Header for Page 178
178,,Automated Processing Options,Header for Page 178

178,Automated Processing Options,"Automated processing options are available to bring the transaction data files from the registered source systems into Accounting Hub. This includes data from other external sources, such as other company-specific applications, transaction applications, or legacy applications. Optionally, data transformation processing may be required for data sourced from PaaS or other external files.",Header for Page 178

178,Automated Processing Options,Transaction data in CSV format are imported into Accounting Hub using the Universal Content Management with one of three available integration options:,Header for Page 178
178,,"Oracle WebCenter Content Document Transfer Utility Oracle UCM Web Services ERP Integration Service, upload to UCM",Header for Page 178

178,"Oracle WebCenter Content Document Transfer Utility Oracle UCM Web Services ERP Integration Service, upload to UCM",Import the transaction data using the Import Accounting Transactions process.,Header for Page 178

178,"Oracle WebCenter Content Document Transfer Utility Oracle UCM Web Services ERP Integration Service, upload to UCM","The Create Accounting process is automatically called, resulting in the creation of journal entries.",Header for Page 178

178,"Oracle WebCenter Content Document Transfer Utility Oracle UCM Web Services ERP Integration Service, upload to UCM","For more information about automated processing options, see the following resources in the Oracle Help Center:",Header for Page 178

178,"Oracle WebCenter Content Document Transfer Utility Oracle UCM Web Services ERP Integration Service, upload to UCM",Oracle Fusion Middleware Developer's Guide for Content Server: Auditing Web Services,Header for Page 178
178,"Oracle WebCenter Content Document Transfer Utility Oracle UCM Web Services ERP Integration Service, upload to UCM",Oracle Integration Cloud Service,Header for Page 178
178,"Oracle WebCenter Content Document Transfer Utility Oracle UCM Web Services ERP Integration Service, upload to UCM",Oracle Accounting Hub Best Practice guide,Header for Page 178
178,,Upload Encrypted Data,Header for Page 178

178,Upload Encrypted Data,"You can use data encryption to secure data files sent to the Accounting Hub Cloud Service. In this case, the Import Accounting Transactions process decrypts the data files using the Cloud private key and then starts the load and import process.",Header for Page 178
178,Upload Encrypted Data,Here are the steps to upload encrypted transaction data:,Header for Page 178

178,Upload Encrypted Data,"1. On the Certificates tab of Security Console, generate a PGP public and private key pair. Then, export the Cloud public key. 2. In an external encryption utility, you generate the customer side key pair by using the Cloud public key. 3. Export the customer public key. 4. On the Certificates tab of Security Console, import the customer public key. 5. In an external encryption utility, encrypt the transaction data ZIP file using the Cloud public key. 6. When uploading the encrypted .zip file into UCM, provide encryption details in the Comments field in the following format:",Header for Page 178
178,"Upload Encrypted Data
column2: 1. On the Certificates tab of Security Console, generate a PGP public and private key pair. Then, export the Cloud public key. 2. In an external encryption utility, you generate the customer side key pair by using the Cloud public key. 3. Export the customer public key. 4. On the Certificates tab of Security Console, import the customer public key. 5. In an external encryption utility, encrypt the transaction data ZIP file using the Cloud public key. 6. When uploading the encrypted .zip file into UCM, provide encryption details in the Comments field in the following format:",FileEncryption=PGPUNSIGNED;FA_ALIAS=CLOUD_KEY;CUSTOMER_ALIAS=YOUR_KEY,Header for Page 178

column1: 178,Upload Encrypted Data,"Where, CLOUD_KEY is the Cloud public key alias, YOUR_KEY is the customer public key alias.",Header for Page 178
178,Upload Encrypted Data,Note: You can provide the comments using the AppendFileComment operation of the ERP Integration Service or through WebCenter Content Server.,Header for Page 178

180,,Advanced Features for Importing Transaction Data to Accounting Hub,Header for Page 180

180,Advanced Features for Importing Transaction Data to Accounting Hub,"You have the flexibility to upload transaction from Universal Content Manager to the interface table, import accounting transactions from the interface table, and create accounting as three separate processes.",Header for Page 180

180,Advanced Features for Importing Transaction Data to Accounting Hub,"For example, you can choose to split a large batch of accounting transactions into multiple data files and import them to interface table separately. After all the files are uploaded, you can submit the Import Accounting Transactions from Interface process to import all transactions into Accounting Hub and create accounting. Optionally, you can create accounting using the Create Accounting process at a later stage.",Header for Page 180
180,Advanced Features for Importing Transaction Data to Accounting Hub,"To have such a flexibility for importing transaction data, you have to do these tasks:",Header for Page 180

181,Configure Parameters for the Import Accounting Transactions from Interface Process,"You use the Import Accounting Transaction from Interface process to import transaction data from interface tables into Accounting Hub. For example, you may choose to load transactions to interface tables without triggering the import in the same run. Later, you can use the Import Accounting Transactions from Interface process to import these transactions. This is an optional process, and you only need to run this if the Import Accounting Transactions process is submitted with Import from Interface = N.",Header for Page 181

182,,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Header for Page 182

182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,"The ERP Data Integration REST Service enables high-performance processing of large transaction sets during import into Accounting Hub. It automates accounting and posting, provides real-time monitoring, and supports seamless integration with source systems.",Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Key capabilities include:,Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Extreme scalability with optimized transaction processing using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Data Flow.,Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,"Automated orchestration of accounting and posting processes, eliminating manual intervention.",Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,"Real-time monitoring with access to processing status, exceptions, and transaction metrics.",Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Consolidated exception management with reports that include recommended resolutions.,Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Processing Stages,Header for Page 182

182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,1. Data validation Scans uploaded files and validates transaction data. 2. Data import Imports validated transactions into Accounting Hub. 3. Post processing Accounts and posts transactions to the general ledger.,Header for Page 182

182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,"When using this service, you do not need to submit the Import Accounting Transactions process, as all required validations are performed automatically.",Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Customization and Enhancements,Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,"Customize the date format for transaction data files. If not specified, the system uses YYYY-MM-DD.",Header for Page 182

182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Override the default final accounting mode by adding Accounting Mode Code: D to the metadata file to generate draft accounting for testing.,Header for Page 182

182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Enable the Process Multiple Ledgers in a Single Process Run enhancement to improve processing efficiency for large transaction volumes.,Header for Page 182
182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,Access Requirements,Header for Page 182

182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,"Users must have the Import Subledger Accounting Transactions (XLA_IMPORT_SUBLEDGER_ACCOUNTING_TRANSACTIONS_PRIV) privilege, which is included in the Accounting Hub Integration Duty (ORA_XLA_ACCOUNTING_HUB_INTEGRATION_DUTY) role.",Header for Page 182

182,Extreme Scale and Monitoring with ERP Data Integration REST Service,"For API details, authentication requirements, and implementation steps, see the REST API for Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials guide.",Header for Page 182

184,,Delete Final Accounted Transactions,Header for Page 184

184,Delete Final Accounted Transactions,"The Accounting Hub Maintenance process is scheduled automatically by the Import Accounting Transactions process in the Purge final accounted transactions mode to delete processed transactions after the specified transaction retention period. However, Accounting Hub retains some transactions beyond the transaction retention period:",Header for Page 184

184,Delete Final Accounted Transactions,Transactions that are used to create multiperiod accounting entries. This type of transactions is kept until the end date of the multiperiod duration.,Header for Page 184
184,Delete Final Accounted Transactions,Unaccounted and invalid transactions aren't purged even after the transaction retention period.,Header for Page 184

184,Delete Final Accounted Transactions,"By default, the transaction retention period is of 90 days. However, you can change the duration of transaction retention period based on your requirements. To change the accounting retention period, navigate to the Manage Subledger Accounting Lookups page, and assign the number of days to retain transactions as the lookup code for the ORA_XLA_AHC_RETENTION_DAYS lookup type. The minimum value of transaction retention period can be 30 days and the maximum value can be 458 days.",Header for Page 184

184,Delete Final Accounted Transactions,"Note: You should carefully evaluate the reasons for extending the retention period because it can adversely impact application performance. If you require any key transaction information for analysis and reconciliation, you should use them as attributes of the resulting accounting entries. So, you need not retain the processed transaction data for a longer duration.",Header for Page 184

184,Delete Final Accounted Transactions,"When you delete final accounted transactions only the corresponding transaction objects records are deleted. The associated accounting events, transaction entities, and subledger journal entries remain intact for future analysis and audit purposes.",Header for Page 184

184,Delete Final Accounted Transactions,"Note: You can edit the default schedule of the Accounting Hub Maintenance process to control when to run the process. To do so, select an instance of the Accounting Hub Maintenance process on the Scheduled Processes page. Then, click Edit Schedule and modify the schedule.",Header for Page 184
184,,Delete Unaccounted Transactions,Header for Page 184

184,Delete Unaccounted Transactions,You can run the Accounting Hub Maintenance process in the Purge unaccounted transactions mode to delete unaccounted transactions that were incorrectly imported.,Header for Page 184
184,,Delete Invalid Transactions,Header for Page 184

184,Delete Invalid Transactions,You run the Accounting Hub Maintenance process in the Purge invalid transactions mode to delete invalid transaction data along with the resulting invalid subledger journal entries.,Header for Page 184

184,Delete Invalid Transactions,"Note: Optionally, you can enable the Automatically delete invalid transactions option on the Manage Subledger Application page. This lets the Create Accounting for Data Set process automatically run the Accounting Hub Maintenance process in the Purge invalid transactions mode and delete invalid transaction data at the end of the run.",Header for Page 184
184,,Purge Pending Reversal Transactions,Header for Page 184

184,Purge Pending Reversal Transactions,Submit the Accounting Hub Maintenance program with the Purge Pending Reversal Transactions from Interface mode to remove unprocessed reversal transactions from the interface table.,Header for Page 184

184,Purge Pending Reversal Transactions,"If a reversal transaction doesnt have a matching original transaction, it stays in the interface table and can slow down processing over time.",Header for Page 184
184,Purge Pending Reversal Transactions,176,Header for Page 184

186,Correcting the Transactions,"When you run the Accounting Hub Maintenance process in the Purge invalid transactions or Purge unaccounted transactions mode, the application generates these files:",Header for Page 186
186,Correcting the Transactions,An output file listing the deleted transactions.,Header for Page 186
186,Correcting the Transactions,Two CSV files with transaction header and line details for the deleted transactions.,Header for Page 186

186,Correcting the Transactions,"The layout of the CSV files follows the updated transaction templates. You can review the CSV files, change the source value as needed, and import the accounting transactions again.",Header for Page 186
186,,Sweep Accounting Hub Transactions to Next Open Period,Header for Page 186
186,Sweep Accounting Hub Transactions to Next Open Period
column2: Correcting the Transactions,Sweep unresolved Accounting Hub transactions from a previous accounting period to the next open period.,Header for Page 186

column1: 186,Sweep Accounting Hub Transactions to Next Open Period
column2: Correcting the Transactions,"By sweeping unresolved transactions, you can address outstanding issues in the subsequent period without delaying the period close. Without this feature, you'd need to close the ledger period without accounting for the errored transaction, requiring a manual adjustment post-facto, or risking a loss of transaction traceability. With this capability, you can retain the original transaction for traceability and process it in the next open period after resolving the error.",Header for Page 186

column1: 186,Sweep Accounting Hub Transactions to Next Open Period
column2: Correcting the Transactions,This feature also enhances the purge invalid transactions and purge unaccounted transactions options by adding a filter to purge by accounting period.,Header for Page 186

column1: 186,Sweep Accounting Hub Transactions to Next Open Period
column2: Correcting the Transactions,Here are the steps to submit the Accounting Hub Maintenance process in sweep mode:,Header for Page 186

column1: 186,Sweep Accounting Hub Transactions to Next Open Period
column2: Correcting the Transactions,1. Make sure to enable the Purge period filter as described in the Steps to Enable. 2. Submit the Accounting Hub Maintenance process with following parameters-,Header for Page 186

column1: 186,Sweep Accounting Hub Transactions to Next Open Period
column2: Correcting the Transactions,a. Select the Mode as Sweep Invalid closed period transactions. b. Select the Subledger Application and Ledger for the invalid transactions that need to be swept to the next open period. c. Choose the Accounting Period as the prior closed period for which Sweep process needs to be executed. 3. The Accounting Hub Maintenance process identifies eligible invalid transactions and updates the GL date source to the first day of the next open period. The transactions picked up and updated are listed in the report output for record and audit. 4. Submit the Create Accounting process for the next open period.,Header for Page 186

column1: 186,Sweep Accounting Hub Transactions to Next Open Period
187,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 187
187,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 187
187,,Note:,Header for Page 187
187,,The Accounting Period parameter list only displays periods associated with the selected ledger that have the status of Closed or Permanently Closed.,Header for Page 187
187,,"The Sweep process runs only for the selected ledger. If associated secondary ledgers exist, you must explicitly submit the process for them.",Header for Page 187
187,,Here are the steps to purge invalid transactions from a prior period:,Header for Page 187
187,,1. Make sure to enable the Purge period filter as described in the Steps to Enable. 2. Submit the Accounting Hub Maintenance process with following parameters-,Header for Page 187
187,,a. Select the Mode as Purge invalid transactions. b. Select the Subledger Application and Ledger for the invalid transactions that need to be deleted.,Header for Page 187

187,,c. Select the Accounting Period to delete the invalid transactions. 3. The process deletes invalid transactions where transaction dates correspond to the accounting period chosen for the specified ledger and subledger application. Here are the steps to purge unaccounted transactions from a prior period:,Header for Page 187
187,,1. Make sure to enable the Purge period filter as described in the Steps to Enable. 2. Submit the Accounting Hub Maintenance process with following parameters-,Header for Page 187
187,,a. Select the Mode as Purge unaccounted transactions. b. Select the Subledger Application and Ledger for the invalid transactions that need to be deleted.,Header for Page 187

187,,c. Choose the inbound datafile to purge all unaccounted transactions for the selected ledger. Use this parameter if the datafile needs reprocessing. d. Specify the Accounting Period to purge unaccounted transactions for a particular period. Use this parameter when the unaccounted transactions from a prior period are no longer required to be processed for accounting. 3. The process deletes unaccounted transactions where transaction dates correspond to the accounting period chosen for the specified ledger and subledger application.,Header for Page 187

187,,Note: Exercise caution when selecting the Accounting Period for purging invalid and unaccounted transactions. An Accounting Period can be specified for this mode irrespective of the period status. Some key benefits are:,Header for Page 187
187,,Maintains the original transaction for traceability and granularity.,Header for Page 187
187,,Promotes data hygiene and maintenance of accounting data.,Header for Page 187
187,,Allows business proper error root cause resolution without affecting period close.,Header for Page 187
187,,Steps to Enable,Header for Page 187
187,Steps to Enable,Here are the steps to enable sweep invalid closed period transactions:,Header for Page 187

187,Steps to Enable,1. Navigate to Manage Standard Lookups Task. 2. Search for Lookup type ORA_ERP_CONTROLLED_CONFIG. 3. Create lookup code XLA_36373252. 4. Enter Meaning as Sweep Invalid closed period transactions.,Header for Page 187
187,Steps to Enable,"Once enabled, the parameter From Accounting Period will be enabled.",Header for Page 187

187,Steps to Enable,"Note: The Mode parameter will continue to show Sweep Invalid closed period transactions even if the Sweep mode is not enabled, however the program will not execute the sweep unless the capability has been enabled.",Header for Page 187
187,Steps to Enable,179,Header for Page 187
188,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 188
188,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 188
188,,Here are the steps to enable purge invalid and unaccounted transactions by period:,Header for Page 188

188,,1. Navigate to Manage Standard Lookups Task. 2. Search for Lookup type ORA_ERP_CONTROLLED_CONFIG. 3. Create lookup code XLA_36730127. 4. Enter Meaning as Purge Invalid and Unaccounted Transactions By Period.,Header for Page 188
188,,"Once enabled, the additional parameter Accounting Period will be enabled.",Header for Page 188

Summarize by general ledger period
Indicates that all subledger entry lines are summarized into a single general ledger entry if they
have the same:
◦ Accounting period
◦ General ledger journal category
◦ Account
◦ Entered currency
◦ Side
◦ Balance type
Disabled if the ledger uses daily balancing.
The general ledger effective date defaults to the last date of the accounting period.

column1: the same:
◦ Accounting date
◦ General ledger journal category
◦ Account
◦ Entered currency
◦ Side
◦ Balance type
The general ledger effective date is equal to the subledger accounting date."

192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,"Note: In actual cases, the Create Accounting process may continue to process transactions even after the Stop at Error Limit is reached and may result in more errors than the error limit. This happens because transactions are processed in batches. If the application starts processing a batch, it continues to process all the transactions in the batch even if the Stop at Error Limit is reached.",Header for Page 192

192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,Importing information from subledgers is done using subledger accounting. Posting from the subledger application transfers data to the general ledger interface and journal entry tables.,Header for Page 192

192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,"As part of your configuration, you can specify whether the Create Accounting process is to split the creation process into multiple workers (processors). The benefit of splitting the creation process is that:",Header for Page 192
192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,Accounting can be generated more efficiently with more resources allocated to complete the process.,Header for Page 192

192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,You can have multiple processors running in parallel to create the entries in a shorter period of time.,Header for Page 192

192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,"One restriction is the capacity of the hardware that's being used by the application. The more available processors, the more you can allocate to the Create Accounting process.",Header for Page 192

192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,"The decision for how many processors to use is made based upon expected volumes and the processing window. In other words, how much time is allocated to creating accounting. Accounting is often done as a nightly batch process, to facilitate application availability during work hours.",Header for Page 192

192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,"Dependencies exist between the overall completion status of the Create Accounting process and the workers. In general, the parent doesn't update to the Completed status until all the workers successfully complete.",Header for Page 192

192,Maximum number of events allowed to fail before canceling account program.,"The process that allows transfer of subledger journal entries to general ledger uses separate processing workers that are specialized in general ledger transfer. A lightweight general ledger transfer parent process is used to distribute the workload to the workers. To transfer entries even faster, you can have a number of parallel processing workers used for high volume general ledger transfer flow. If not specified, the corresponding accounting processors are used.",Header for Page 192

195,,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance,Header for Page 195
195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance,Here are some tips and recommendations to improve Create Accounting program performance:,Header for Page 195

195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance,"You must control the Create Accounting job submission. For example, only submit the Create Accounting jobs for the same application/same ledger simultaneously if the application is in row lock mode.",Header for Page 195

195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance,"You must understand that the maximum volume for an application is equal to the number of ledger combinations. So, for example, if an application with a ledger has 1000 mn and 1 mn volume, you should consider 1mn as your target volume and set workers accordingly.",Header for Page 195

195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance,"For volume up to few thousand, you can restrict 1 worker. For volume > 50K, increase CA workers to 3 with processing unit size 1000, GL_transfer workers 2 processing unit size 10K. For volume > 100K, increase CA workers to 5 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 3 processing unit size 40K. For volume > 500K, increase CA workers to 7 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 4 processing unit size 40K.",Header for Page 195
195,"Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: For volume up to few thousand, you can restrict 1 worker. For volume > 50K, increase CA workers to 3 with processing unit size 1000, GL_transfer workers 2 processing unit size 10K. For volume > 100K, increase CA workers to 5 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 3 processing unit size 40K. For volume > 500K, increase CA workers to 7 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 4 processing unit size 40K.",You can achieve optimum performance by staggering the Create Accounting runs for various application- ledger combinations.,Header for Page 195

column1: 195,"Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: For volume up to few thousand, you can restrict 1 worker. For volume > 50K, increase CA workers to 3 with processing unit size 1000, GL_transfer workers 2 processing unit size 10K. For volume > 100K, increase CA workers to 5 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 3 processing unit size 40K. For volume > 500K, increase CA workers to 7 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 4 processing unit size 40K.",Set up Manage Subledger Accounting Options UI in Functional Setup Manager (FSM) to control multiple accounting sub-processes per Create Accounting process request.,Header for Page 195

column1: 195,"Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: For volume up to few thousand, you can restrict 1 worker. For volume > 50K, increase CA workers to 3 with processing unit size 1000, GL_transfer workers 2 processing unit size 10K. For volume > 100K, increase CA workers to 5 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 3 processing unit size 40K. For volume > 500K, increase CA workers to 7 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 4 processing unit size 40K.","You can change the Number of Create Accounting Workers from the System Options in the Manage Subledger Accounting Options page. The number of workers default is 1. Be careful while changing this parameter. For example, if the production environment is of M6 size and Create Accounting takes a long time as there is only one worker set up now, it could help if you increase it up to 4 or 6.",Header for Page 195

column1: 195,"Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: For volume up to few thousand, you can restrict 1 worker. For volume > 50K, increase CA workers to 3 with processing unit size 1000, GL_transfer workers 2 processing unit size 10K. For volume > 100K, increase CA workers to 5 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 3 processing unit size 40K. For volume > 500K, increase CA workers to 7 with processing unit size 5000, GL_transfer workers 4 processing unit size 40K.","The Create Accounting program performance also depends on the number of Accounting Hub applications available and transaction volume being processed at a time. For example, if transaction volume is high (100,000 +) in one of the Create Accounting request scope, increase the workers incrementally to improve the performance. Note that a large number ( > 10) of workers per Accounting hub application running Create Accounting in parallel can have contention and can adverse the performance.",Header for Page 195

column1: 195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance,Best Practices,Header for Page 195
195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: Best Practices,Here are some best practices to deal with Create Accounting program performance issues:,Header for Page 195

column1: 195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: Best Practices,"The performance of the Create Accounting program depends on the time taken by various child jobs spawned by the program. Therefore, follow the below steps to increase the number of workers for Create Accounting and transfer to the GL subprogram:",Header for Page 195

column1: 195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: Best Practices,"a. From the Setup and Maintenance work area, navigate to the Define Accounting Transformation Configuration task and go to Manage Subledger Accounting Options. Search for your ledger, expand and open the Cost Management application. Edit the System options to change the Number of Create Accounting Workers from 1 to 10 and change the Number of General Ledger Transfer Workers to 2. b. Cancel the running Create Accounting job and resubmit a new one.",Header for Page 195

column1: 195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: Best Practices,Ensure the profile option Enable SLA debug mode is turned off.,Header for Page 195

column1: 195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance
column2: Best Practices,Ensure no Finest log levels are enabled.,Header for Page 195

column1: 195,Tips to Improve Accounting Performance

196,Create Accounting Execution Report,"When you submit the Create Accounting process, the Create Accounting Execution Report is submitted automatically if the Create Accounting process completes with a success or warning status. The Create Accounting process output contains a message with the Create Accounting Execution Report request identifier.",Header for Page 196
196,Create Accounting Execution Report,Use this request identifier to retrieve the execution report output.,Header for Page 196
196,Create Accounting Execution Report,Create Accounting Execution Report,Header for Page 196
196,Create Accounting Execution Report
column2: Create Accounting Execution Report,"Besides the automatic generation, you can also generate the Create Accounting Execution Report using these criteria:",Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Create Accounting Execution Report
column2: Create Accounting Execution Report,Submit the Create Accounting process.,Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Create Accounting Execution Report
column2: Create Accounting Execution Report,"Use the request identifier of the wanted Create Accounting process that was run previously by the same user. However, no other Create Accounting process should have been run with the same criteria.",Header for Page 196

column1: 196,,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data,Header for Page 196
196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Create Accounting Execution Report,You can use the diagnostic framework to know why the accounting was created in a particular way or why there are errors.,Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Create Accounting Execution Report,The diagnostic framework stores data that is used in the creation of a journal entry so you can use the data to analyze accounting issues. It provides the transaction data that is referenced during accounting through accounting rules and ledger setup. Most errors occur because either the source system information or the accounting rules are not as expected.,Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Create Accounting Execution Report,Here are some ways in which you can use the diagnostic framework.,Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Create Accounting Execution Report,"In the implementation phase, you can launch the Accounting Event Diagnostic report to review the source values available in the transaction objects.",Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Create Accounting Execution Report,"On a daily basis, you can use the Accounting Event Diagnostic report to troubleshoot exceptions.",Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data,Diagnostic Framework Features,Header for Page 196
196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Diagnostic Framework Features,The diagnostic framework features are as follows:,Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Diagnostic Framework Features,SLA: Diagnostic Enabled: This option controls whether diagnostic information is gathered by the Create Accounting process. Use with caution. Selecting this option can cause slow performance.,Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Diagnostic Framework Features,"Diagnostic Framework Execution: When the SLA: Diagnostic Enabled option is set to Yes, the diagnostic framework is executed simultaneously with the Create Accounting process. The diagnostic framework data is stored in the diagnostic tables.",Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Diagnostic Framework Features,"Accounting Event Diagnostic Report: To view the diagnostic framework report, users submit the Accounting Event Diagnostic process with the appropriate report parameters.",Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
column2: Diagnostic Framework Features,Purge Accounting Event Diagnostic Data: Purging is useful when accounting is successfully created so that the volume of information in the report does not increase to a point where it becomes unusable. Diagnostic framework data purged:,Header for Page 196

column1: 196,Diagnose Subledger Accounting Event Data
197,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 197
197,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 197
197,,When the data collected can be purged by running the process. When the administrator launches the Purge Accounting Event Diagnostic Data process.,Header for Page 197
197,,Diagnostic Framework Business Process Flow,Header for Page 197
197,Diagnostic Framework Business Process Flow,The following steps describe the diagnostic framework business process flow:,Header for Page 197

197,Diagnostic Framework Business Process Flow,"1. The administrator sets the SLA: Diagnostics Enabled option to Yes for the user or responsibility. 2. Users submit the Create Accounting process that automatically executes the diagnostic framework to populate the diagnostic tables. The diagnostic framework gathers source values and other information from the transaction objects. 3. Users submit the Accounting Event Diagnostic process to view the diagnostic report. Based on the information in the diagnostic report, users may determine if additional or resubmission of information from source systems is required. They may also determine if any updates to the accounting rules is required. 4. Users run the Create Accounting process again to generate subledger journal entries for events that had an error. 5. The administrator submits the Purge Accounting Event Diagnostic Data process to purge the results of the diagnostic framework.",Header for Page 197
197,,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting,Header for Page 197
197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting
column2: Diagnostic Framework Business Process Flow,Automatically partition a single Accounting Hub transaction with hundreds of thousands of lines into smaller transactions during import. The Create Accounting process then processes these smaller transactions in parallel for faster completion.,Header for Page 197

column1: 197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting,How It Works,Header for Page 197
197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting
column2: How It Works,"When this feature is enabled, Accounting Hub transactions that exceed 100,000 lines are automatically split into smaller transactions, each containing 300 lines or fewer, based on a configurable grouping criterion. These small transactions are then independently processed using the suspense account assigned to the ledger to generate balanced accounting entries.",Header for Page 197

column1: 197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting
column2: How It Works,"If suspense is not enabled or another account is required, users can configure an alternative clearing account. If the original large transaction results in a balanced entry, the suspense or clearing account nets to zero after all small transactions are successfully accounted.",Header for Page 197

column1: 197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting
column2: How It Works,"By default, transaction lines with different values in the Default Currency column aren't grouped together in the same small transaction. You can configure additional line-level sources as grouping attributes so that lines with different values for these sources are also processed separately.",Header for Page 197

column1: 197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting
197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting
column2: How It Works,"If a transaction has 200,000 lines, all with the same currency and balancing segment value, and suspense is enabled, this feature creates 667 smaller transactions (each with 300 lines or fewer). The accounting entry for each small transaction is balanced using the suspense account. The total suspense amount across all transactions will net to zero if the original transaction is balanced. If suspense is not enabled or a different account is needed, you can configure a custom account rule to derive the clearing account.",Header for Page 197

column1: 197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting,Steps to Enable,Header for Page 197
197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting
column2: Steps to Enable,Here are the steps to enable this feature.,Header for Page 197

column1: 197,Automatically Prepare Large Volume Transactions for Accounting

198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,Enable Group Source Data on Import,Header for Page 198

198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,"To enable group source data on import in the Manage Subledger Applications task, complete these steps:",Header for Page 198

198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,"1. Navigate to Setup and Maintenance. 2. Select the Fusion Accounting Hub setup offering. 3. Click the Accounting Transformation functional area. 4. Click the Manage Subledger Applications setup task and set the scope for your accounting hub subledger. 5. Select the event class in the Event Model Hierarchy. 6. In the General Information tab, select Group Source Data on Import. 7. Save your changes.",Header for Page 198
198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,Configure Additional Sources as Grouping Attributes,Header for Page 198

198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,"Assign additional sources as grouping attributes, if applicable. You can assign any line-level source as a grouping attribute to prevent transaction lines with different default currency and grouping attribute values from being grouped into the same event.",Header for Page 198

198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,1. Navigate to Setup and Maintenance. 2. Select the Fusion Accounting Hub setup offering. 3. Click the Accounting Transformation functional area. 4. Click the Manage Sources setup task and set the scope for your accounting hub subledger. 5. Select the Group By attribute for the source. 6. Save your changes.,Header for Page 198
198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,Configure a Clearing Account Instead of the Default Suspense Account,Header for Page 198

198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,"If suspense is not enabled or you want to use a different clearing account, complete these steps:",Header for Page 198

198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,"1. Define an account rule to derive the clearing account used to balance individual subledger accounting entries for a large transaction. 2. Assign the predefined journal line rule Balancing Line for Source Data Grouping to your journal entry rule set. 3. Navigate to Setup and Maintenance. 4. Select the Fusion Accounting Hub setup offering. 5. Click the Accounting Transformation functional area. 6. Click the Manage Journal Entry Rule Set setup task and set the scope for your accounting hub subledger. 7. Edit the journal entry rule set associated with the large transaction's event type. 8. In the Journal Line region, add a row. 9. Search for and assign the predefined journal line rule Balancing Line for Source Data Grouping to the rule set. 10. Assign account rules to the Balancing Line for Source Data Grouping. 11. Save your changes. 12. Activate the subledger journal entry rule set assignments.",Header for Page 198
198,Lookup Code: XLA_36121027 Enabled: Selected Meaning: Display Group Source Data Option in UI,190,Header for Page 198

199,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 199
199,,Tips And Considerations,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,Keep these key points in mind when using this feature.,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,Unsupported Configurations,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,This feature does not work if:,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,The Flexible Configuration of Accounting Hub Cloud Service End-to-End Flow feature is not enabled.,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,Transfer to EBS General Ledger is enabled.,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,Transfer to PeopleSoft General Ledger is enabled.,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,Grouping Transaction Lines,Header for Page 199

199,Tips And Considerations,"Transaction lines in a large transaction with the same Default Currency value and designated grouping attributes are grouped into the same accounting entry. If the large transaction results in multiple balancing segment values, assign any sources used to derive the balancing segment as grouping attributes. This reduces the number of balancing lines created.",Header for Page 199

199,Tips And Considerations,"For example, if the Category source determines the GL account balancing segment, set it as a grouping attribute. If you need a supporting reference on the clearing line, assign the supporting reference source as a grouping attribute. However, using too many grouping attributes can slow performance and increase the number of accounting entries.",Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,"If a source other than Default Currency determines the entered currency, set that source as a grouping attribute to minimize clearing lines.",Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,Handling Balancing and Clearing Accounts,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,"If the large transaction is not balanced by balancing segments, intercompany balancing amounts are posted to the suspense or clearing account.",Header for Page 199

199,Tips And Considerations,"If the large transaction includes multiple currencies and is not balanced by currency, currency balancing amounts are posted to the suspense or clearing account.",Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,"If exchange gain or loss occurs in a subledger-level reporting currency or secondary ledger, the amount may be posted to the clearing account.",Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,Fixing Invalid Accounting Entries,Header for Page 199

199,Tips And Considerations,"If any small transaction within a large transaction creates an invalid accounting entry, the valid entries will still be processed and posted to the General Ledger. To correct the invalid entry, follow these steps based on whether transaction reversal is enabled.",Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,If transaction reversal is enabled:,Header for Page 199

199,Tips And Considerations,1. Reverse the transaction to cancel the accounting impact of the posted journal. 2. Run the Accounting Hub Maintenance process in Purge Invalid Transaction mode to remove the invalid small transaction and its reversal. 3. Re-import the transaction with new transaction numbers after fixing the data or configuration issue.,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,If transaction reversal is not enabled:,Header for Page 199

199,Tips And Considerations,1. Re-import the large transaction with negative amounts to offset the original posted journal. 2. Run the Accounting Hub Maintenance process in Purge Invalid Transaction mode to remove the invalid small transactions. 3. Re-import the transaction with new transaction numbers after correcting the data or configuration issue.,Header for Page 199
199,Tips And Considerations,191,Header for Page 199

200,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 200
200,,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,Header for Page 200

200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,"Post subledger journals to the general ledger when you create accounting, or run the Post Subledger Journal Entries process to transfer and post at a later time.",Header for Page 200
200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,To post to General Ledger:,Header for Page 200

200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,Make sure that the Enable Posting from Subledger option is enabled so that you can automatically post subledger journals to GL.,Header for Page 200

200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,"Note: If the Enable Posting from Subledger option is disabled, you can't post the subledger journal to GL but you can transfer the subledger journal to GL.",Header for Page 200
200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,"Alternatively, you must have the privilege to execute this task.",Header for Page 200

200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,"With the required privileges and settings, you can select the Account and Post to Ledger option to create and post journal entries to the general ledger, during the online Create Accounting process.",Header for Page 200

200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,"If you don't have the post to GL (GL_POST_JOURNAL_PRIV) privilege, select Account in Final to create journal entries and transfer to General Ledger.",Header for Page 200
200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,You can view the output of the Post Subledger Journal Entries process for the summary of the transfer process.,Header for Page 200

200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,You can manually run the Create Accounting process to create accounting for a batch of transactions. Set the following parameters to create journal entries and post to the general ledger.,Header for Page 200
200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,Accounting Mode is set to Final.,Header for Page 200
200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,Transfer to General Ledger is set to Yes.,Header for Page 200
200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,Post in General Ledger is set to Yes.,Header for Page 200

200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,"If you don't have the post to GL (GL_POST_JOURNAL_PRIV) privilege or posting from the Enable Posting from Subledger option is disabled, the Post in General Ledger parameter isn't available.",Header for Page 200
200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,Transfer Manual Subledger Journal to General Ledger By Preparer,Header for Page 200
200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger
column2: Transfer Manual Subledger Journal to General Ledger By Preparer,You can transfer manual subledger journal entries to the general ledger immediately while creating subledger journals using the UI or a spreadsheet. You may also choose to create the manual subledger journal entries in Final status and use the Post Subledger Journal Entries process to transfer the manual subledger journal entries to the general ledger later. Manual journal entries created by different users are split into separate general ledger journal batches. This facilitates routing the journal batches to different approvers or reviewers based on the preparer. You can also choose to transfer all subledger journals or exclude manual journal entries while submitting the Post Subledger Journal Entries process.,Header for Page 200

column1: 200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger
column2: Transfer Manual Subledger Journal to General Ledger By Preparer,Here are the changes applied after enabling this feature:,Header for Page 200

column1: 200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger
column2: Transfer Manual Subledger Journal to General Ledger By Preparer,"When you create subledger journals using a spreadsheet with Completion Status as 'Final and Transfer' or 'Final and Post,' eligible manual subledger journals created by the same user will only be transferred to the general ledger. Manual subledger journals created by other users will not be transferred.",Header for Page 200

column1: 200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger
column2: Transfer Manual Subledger Journal to General Ledger By Preparer,"In the Journal Batch field, you can optionally enter any text as a prefix to the General Ledger journal batch.",Header for Page 200

column1: 200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger
column2: Transfer Manual Subledger Journal to General Ledger By Preparer,You can select one of the following options from Journal Entries to Transfer while submitting the Post Subledger Journal Entries ESS Parameter:,Header for Page 200

column1: 200,Post Subledger Transactions to the General Ledger,All - Transfer all subledger journals.,Header for Page 200

column1: 201,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 201
201,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 201

201,,All except Manual Journals - Exclude manual subledger journals from transferring to the general ledger. Manual Journals created by me - Only transfer manual subledger journals created by the current user.,Header for Page 201

201,All except Manual Journals - Exclude manual subledger journals from transferring to the general ledger. Manual Journals created by me - Only transfer manual subledger journals created by the current user.,Tips and Considerations,Header for Page 201

201,All except Manual Journals - Exclude manual subledger journals from transferring to the general ledger. Manual Journals created by me - Only transfer manual subledger journals created by the current user.,"You can also create manual subledger journal entries using the Create Subledger Journal page and group them into one GL batch by posting them using the Post Subledger Journal Entries process. When you select the option Manual Journals created by me, in the Journal Entries to Transfer parameter, all manual adjustments entered through UI or spreadsheet are grouped into one GL batch.",Header for Page 201

201,All except Manual Journals - Exclude manual subledger journals from transferring to the general ledger. Manual Journals created by me - Only transfer manual subledger journals created by the current user.,"To group all non-transferred accounting hub transactions into one GL batch, you can account the transactions in Final status and then submit the Post Subledger Journal Entries ESS program with Journal Entries to Transfer set to All except Manual Journals. This option will not transfer manual subledger journal entries to GL. It will not select eligible journals by the preparer.",Header for Page 201

201,All except Manual Journals - Exclude manual subledger journals from transferring to the general ledger. Manual Journals created by me - Only transfer manual subledger journals created by the current user.,"If a Journal Batch is not specified in the spreadsheet or you're using an old template, a system-generated batch name will be assigned to the GL journal batch. The maximum length for a Journal Batch should be 50 characters or less.",Header for Page 201
201,,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,Header for Page 201

201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,You can transfer subledger accounting entries directly to General Ledger without running the Post Subledger Journal Entries and Journal Import processes.,Header for Page 201

201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,"Create Accounting generates subledger accounting entries, which are summarized and transferred to the General Ledger through the Post Subledger Journal Entries process and its subsequent Journal Import process.",Header for Page 201

201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,"When you submit the Create Accounting process with the Transfer to General Ledger parameter set to Yes, the Create Accounting sub-process summarizes and transfers the subledger accounting entries to General Ledger without launching the Post Subledger Journal Entries and Journal Import processes. If you submit the standalone Post Subledger Journal Entries process, the subledger accounting entries are transferred to General Ledger without launching the Journal Import process.",Header for Page 201
201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,This feature also includes the following changes:,Header for Page 201

201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,"When a subledger accounting entry points to an invalid account but an alternate account is specified, the system automatically switches to the alternate account for General Ledger journal creation.",Header for Page 201

201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,"In cases where validation errors occur while creating General Ledger journal batches from subledger accounting entries, only the valid entries are moved to the General Ledger, excluding any invalid entries.",Header for Page 201

201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,Validation errors encountered during the subledger accounting entries' transfer to the General Ledger can be examined on the Manage Accounting Errors page.,Header for Page 201

201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,"These enhancements lead to quicker processing times for accounting and journal postings, optimizing the utilization of system resources.",Header for Page 201
201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,Steps to Enable,Header for Page 201
201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,Here are the steps to enable this feature for all Subledger and Accounting Hub applications:,Header for Page 201

201,Directly Transfer Subledger Entries to General Ledger,4. Click on the Setup Task: Manage Subledger Accounting Lookups.,Header for Page 201

You can enter and complete subledger journal adjustment entries from the user interface or upload using a spreadsheet.,Header for Page 202

column1: 205,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 205
205,,Chapter 7 Subledger Accounting,Header for Page 205
205,,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,Header for Page 205
205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,Use the approvals workflow for manual subledger entries to enhance governance of subledger accounting activities.,Header for Page 205

205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,"With a simplified rule configuration, you can enable approvals for specific subledgers, journal sources, and ledgers based on configurable business attributes. Customizable approval rules ensure each manual subledger entry complies with governance policies.",Header for Page 205
205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,Here's why this is useful:,Header for Page 205

205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,Custom Workflow : Define business rules and notifications using spreadsheets to create a workflow tailored to your organizations needs and risk tolerance.,Header for Page 205

205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,Early Issue Detection : Identify and address exceptions early in the subledger accounting process to ensure transaction accuracy before they reach the General Ledger.,Header for Page 205
205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,Eliminate Workarounds : Avoid makeshift solutions by integrating approvals directly into subledger accounting.,Header for Page 205

205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,Maintain Transaction Validity : Ensure transactions remain valid within Subledger Accounting to maintain accurate subledger balances.,Header for Page 205

205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,"Granular Control : Apply detailed governance on subledger attributes, such as supporting references, which General Ledger approvals dont cover early in the process.",Header for Page 205
205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries,Steps to Enable,Header for Page 205
205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries
column2: Steps to Enable,Enable the feature,Header for Page 205

column1: 205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries
column2: Steps to Enable,"1. Navigate to Setup and Maintenance work area. 2. Search and select the Specify Ledger Options page for the applicable ledger. 3. Under the Journal Processing section, select Enable journal and manual subledger entry approval option. 4. Save and Close. 5. Search and select the Manage Journal Sources page. 6. Select the Require Manual Subledger Entry Approval option for the journal sources for which you want to enable approvals. 7. Save and Close.",Header for Page 205

column1: 205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries
column2: Steps to Enable,Upload approval rules,Header for Page 205

column1: 205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries
column2: Steps to Enable,1. Navigate to Setup and Maintenance work area. 2. Search for Manage Workflow Rules in Spreadsheet page. 3. Download the Manual Subledger Entry Approval template. 4. Create the applicable approval rules. 5. Generate the zip file and upload the spreadsheet back into the Manage Workflow Rules in Spreadsheet page. 6. Select Done.,Header for Page 205

column1: 205,Exception-Based Approvals for Manual Subledger Entries
column2: Steps to Enable,Enable ledger and journal source for approvals,Header for Page 205

207,,"This ensures that the journal entry is always balanced, and that any exchange gains or losses are tracked and reported accurately. The system takes into account current exchange rates when calculating the gain or loss.",Header for Page 207

207,,"When suspense is not enabled, currency gain or loss balances are automatically rounded to a user-defined rounding account. You can transfer currency exchange gain or loss balances to another account using a manual journal entry.",Header for Page 207
207,,"When suspense is enabled, the system will still record currency gains or losses against the suspense account.",Header for Page 207

209,Subledger Journal Entry
column2: Overview of Subledger Journal Entry,You can create subledger journal entries by using one of two methods:,Header for Page 209

column1: 209,Subledger Journal Entry
column2: Overview of Subledger Journal Entry,Use the Create Accounting process to process accounting events using accounting rules.,Header for Page 209

column1: 209,Subledger Journal Entry
column2: Overview of Subledger Journal Entry,Create manual subledger journal entries.,Header for Page 209

column1: 209,Subledger Journal Entry
column2: Overview of Subledger Journal Entry,"Subledger journal entries are always created in a given subledger application context. When the subledger journal entry is complete, the appropriate sequence names and numbers are assigned. If applicable, corresponding secondary ledger and reporting currency journal entries are also created.",Header for Page 209

column1: 209,Subledger Journal Entry
column2: Overview of Subledger Journal Entry,"Manual journal entries can be entered for primary ledgers or for secondary ledgers. Manual journals for primary ledgers are automatically created only for associated reporting currencies, not secondary ledgers.",Header for Page 209

210,,Perform subledger journal corrections by editing the account directly on a completed journal entry. Review the original entry together with the correction for easier reconciliation.,Header for Page 210
210,,To correct the account on a subledger journal you must have the Override Subledger Journal Entry (XLA_OVERRIDE_SUBLEDGER_JOURNAL_ENTRY_PRIV) privilege.,Header for Page 210

210,To correct the account on a subledger journal you must have the Override Subledger Journal Entry (XLA_OVERRIDE_SUBLEDGER_JOURNAL_ENTRY_PRIV) privilege.,"Note: If the Enable Posting from Subledger option is enabled, the corrected entry is transferred and posted to GL. However if the option is disabled, the corrected entry is transferred to GL but not posted.",Header for Page 210
210,To correct the account on a subledger journal you must have the Override Subledger Journal Entry (XLA_OVERRIDE_SUBLEDGER_JOURNAL_ENTRY_PRIV) privilege.,Related Topics,Header for Page 210
