263,,"Before you start, do the steps described in these topics.",Header for Page 263
263,,1. Define a Basic Financial Report Using the Reporting Web Studio 2. Add Formulas to a Financial Reporting Report Now follow these steps.,Header for Page 263

263,,1. Double-click the Accounting Period cell. The Select Members dialog box opens. 2. Remove the default accounting period from the Selected area by clicking it to select it and then clicking the Remove from Selected icon. 3. Click the Functions tab. 4. Select Range from the list. 5. Click the Add to Selected icon. The Range dialog box opens. 6. Define the starting member for the range.,Header for Page 263
263,,"a. On the Start Member row, click the Lookup Selection icon in the Value column. b. Click the Functions tab.",Header for Page 263

263,,"c. Select the Relative Member function to define the periods that display on the report relative to the period specified at runtime. d. Click OK . The Relative Member dialog box opens. e. On the Member row, click the Lookup Selection icon in the Value column.",Header for Page 263
263,,"f. Select Current Point of View for Accounting Period so you can enter the starting period for the report. g. Click OK . h. On the Offset row, enter -11 in the Value field.",Header for Page 263

263,,"The offset determines the first period of the range. The starting period in the range function is always the oldest period. Because this is a rolling 12 period report, enter -11 to include the 11 periods prior to the period you enter at runtime. The member selection for the End Member parameter determines period 12. i. Click OK . 7. Define the ending member for the range.",Header for Page 263
263,,"a. On the End Member row, click the Lookup Selection icon in the Value column. b. Select Current Point of View for Accounting Period .",Header for Page 263

263,,"c. Click OK . d. Click OK to close the Range dialog box. e. Click OK to close the Select Members dialog box. 8. Save the report and leave it open for the next topic, which is defining a grid point of view. Optionally preview the report.",Header for Page 263
263,,Set User and Grid Points of View for a Financial Reporting Report,Header for Page 263
263,Set User and Grid Points of View for a Financial Reporting Report,This is the fourth of six topics on designing a financial report with Financial Reporting Web Studio.,Header for Page 263
263,Set User and Grid Points of View for a Financial Reporting Report
column2: This is the fourth of six topics on designing a financial report with Financial Reporting Web Studio.,Watch video,Header for Page 263

column1: 263,Set User and Grid Points of View for a Financial Reporting Report,"In this example, you set a user point of view and a grid point of view for a financial report.",Header for Page 263

263,Set User and Grid Points of View for a Financial Reporting Report,All financial reporting reports have a user point of view and a grid point of view. Best practice is to use a combination of both.,Header for Page 263
263,Set User and Grid Points of View for a Financial Reporting Report,255,Header for Page 263
264,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 264
264,,Chapter 11 Financial Reporting,Header for Page 264

264,,"If you want users to select certain dimension members at runtime, then those dimensions should be set in the user point of view. Selections for user point of view members are global for a user and data source. This means the application saves and applies them to any other report that has the same dimensions set to the user point of view. By default, all dimensions are set to the user point of view and must be selected at runtime. If you want your report to always use certain dimension selections, then select the specific members in the grid point of view.",Header for Page 264
264,,Note: Members of a grid point of view only display in HTML.,Header for Page 264
264,,"In this example you set the Ledger, Scenario, Balance Amount and Currency dimensions to use the grid point of view.",Header for Page 264
264,,"Before you start, do the steps described in these topics.",Header for Page 264

264,,1. Define a Basic Financial Report Using the Reporting Web Studio 2. Add Formulas to a Financial Reporting Report 3. Define Range Functions for a Financial Reporting Report Now follow these steps.,Header for Page 264

264,,"1. Select the cell in the grid that represents the intersection of the rows and columns. The Grid Properties pane opens. 2. In the Grid Properties pane, click the Grid Point of View check box. 3. In the design canvas, click the Ledger : User Point of View for Ledger button. The Select Members dialog box opens. 4. Expand the Ledger member and continue to expand until you find the ledger to include on the report. Select the ledger. 5. Click Apply Selection . 6. Select Scenario from the Dimension list to select the type of balance to use on the report. 7. Expand the Scenario member and select Actual . 8. Click Apply Selection . 9. Select Balance Amount from the Dimension list. 10. Expand the Balance Amount member and select Period Activity . 11. Click Apply Selection . 12. Select Currency from the Dimension list. 13. Search for USD . 14. Click OK to accept the search result. 15. Click Apply Selection . 16. Click OK to close the Select Members dialog box. 17. Save the report and leave it open for the next topic, which is setting page and grid properties. Optionally, preview the report.",Header for Page 264
264,,Work with Grid Point of View Setup and Page Axis for a Financial Reporting Report,Header for Page 264

264,Work with Grid Point of View Setup and Page Axis for a Financial Reporting Report,This is the fifth of six topics on designing a financial report with Financial Reporting Web Studio.,Header for Page 264

column1: 264,Work with Grid Point of View Setup and Page Axis for a Financial Reporting Report,"In this example, you change the grid point of view setup and set the page member selection to a prompt on your financial report.",Header for Page 264
264,Work with Grid Point of View Setup and Page Axis for a Financial Reporting Report,256,Header for Page 264
265,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 265
265,,Chapter 11 Financial Reporting,Header for Page 265
265,,"Before you start, do the tasks described in these topics.",Header for Page 265

265,,1. Define a Basic Financial Report Using the Reporting Web Studio 2. Add Formulas to a Financial Reporting Report 3. Define Range Functions for a Financial Reporting Report 4. Set User and Grid Points of View for a Financial Reporting Report Now follow these steps.,Header for Page 265

265,,1. Click the first cell in the grid to select all of the rows and columns. 2. Right-click and select Grid Point of View Setup from the list. The Setup Grid Point of View dialog box opens.,Header for Page 265

265,,"a. To prevent the Balance Amount dimension from being changed at runtime, select the Lock Member Selection option. b. Click OK . The Setup Grid Point of View window closes. 3. In the Grid Properties pane:",Header for Page 265
265,,a. Click the Drill Through option to allow drilling from the report to the General Ledger transaction data. b. Click the Suppression section to view the suppression settings.,Header for Page 265

265,,"c. Enter 0 in the Zero Values field to set the text option for rows with zero values. If necessary, you could also suppress the display of rows with zero values, rows with missing data, and rows with errors. 4. Set a runtime prompt for the Company dimension so you have the flexibility of selecting any company or combination of companies at runtime. In this example, you want to restrict the valid list of companies that can be selected at runtime.",Header for Page 265
265,,"a. On the grid, click the Pages label. The Company dimension appears in the design canvas. b. Click the Company button. The Select Members dialog box opens.",Header for Page 265

265,,c. Remove the default Company selection from the Selected area by clicking it to select it and then clicking the Remove from Selected icon. d. Select Prompt for Company . e. Click the Add to Selected icon to move the selection to the Selected area.,Header for Page 265

265,,"f. Click OK . The Define Prompts dialog box opens. g. Click the Lookup icon in the Choices List field. The Select Members dialog box opens. h. Remove the default Company selection from the Selected area by clicking it to select it and then clicking the Remove from Selected icon. i. Expand the Company member, and continue expanding until you find and select the default companies you want to display in the prompt. j. Click the Add to Selected icon to move the companies to the Selected area. k. Click OK . The Select Members window closes.",Header for Page 265

265,,"l. On the Define Prompts dialog box, click in the Member Name field and select Alias . The actual company label displays in the prompt list of values instead of a numeric company value, making the prompt more user-friendly. m. Click OK . The Define Prompts window closes. 5. Click the Pages label on the grid. The Page Properties pane opens.",Header for Page 265
265,,"a. In the Page Properties pane, select the Alias : Default option so each page of the report shows the name of the company instead of the number.",Header for Page 265
265,,257,Header for Page 265
266,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 266
266,,Chapter 11 Financial Reporting,Header for Page 266
266,,6. Select the four data rows in the grid so all of the rows have the same settings.,Header for Page 266

266,,"a. In the Heading Row Properties pane, select the Alias : Default option in the Heading Row Properties pane to display the revenue and expense account names instead of the accounts. b. In the Heading Row Properties pane, select the Allow Expansion option so you can expand the parent account values to view the detail child values. 7. Save the report and leave it open for the next topic, which is formatting your financial report and adding a graph. Optionally, preview the report.",Header for Page 266

column1: 266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"In this example, you add formats and graphs to a financial report.",Header for Page 266
266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"Before you start, do the steps described in these topics.",Header for Page 266

266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,1. Define a Basic Financial Report Using the Reporting Web Studio 2. Add Formulas to a Financial Reporting Report 3. Define Range Functions for a Financial Reporting Report 4. Set User and Grid Points of View for a Financial Reporting Report 5. Work with Grid Point of View Setup and Page Axis for a Financial Reporting Report Now follow these steps.,Header for Page 266
266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"1. In the report object browser, select the name of the report, which is the first object. 2. Add a logo.",Header for Page 266

266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"a. In the report layout, drag the header line to make space for the logo and title. b. In the Header section, click the Add Report Object icon and select Image .",Header for Page 266
266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"c. In the Image Properties pane, click Browse and select your company logo. 3. Add a title.",Header for Page 266

266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"a. Select the name of the report in the report object browser. b. In the Header section, click the Add Report Object and select Text . As an alternative, you can click the Text icon in the toolbar and draw the text box. The text box opens. c. Enter the report title. d. Select the title text and use the format toolbar to adjust the font size, center the text, and change the font style to bold. 4. Change the page orientation.",Header for Page 266
266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"a. Select the name of the report in the report object browser. b. On the File , menu, select Page Setup .",Header for Page 266
266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"c. In the Page Setup dialog box, select the Landscape option. d. Click OK . 5. Add a chart.",Header for Page 266

266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,"a. In the Body section, click the Add Report Object icon and select Chart . b. In the Chart Properties pane, select the Line chart type.",Header for Page 266
266,Add Formats and Graphs to a Financial Reporting Report,258,Header for Page 266
267,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 267
267,,Chapter 11 Financial Reporting,Header for Page 267

267,,"c. To show only the expense account rows, deselect row 1, and select rows 3, 4, and 5 in the Data Range section. d. Click the Format Chart button. The Format Chart dialog box opens. e. In the Appearance tab, enter the title for the chart. For example, Expenses by Period .",Header for Page 267

267,,"f. Click the Legend tab and enter a title for the legend. For example, Type of Expenses . g. Click the Axes tab and enter a title for the Metadata axis. For example, Period . Enter a title for the Primary Axis. For example, Dollars . h. Click the Refresh Chart button to preview the chart on the Format Chart dialog box. i. Click OK . The Format Chart dialog box closes. 6. Save the report and optionally, preview it. For more information about Financial Reporting Web Studio, select the Using EPM with Oracle Financials Cloud link from the All Books for Oracle Financials Cloud page of the Oracle Help Center at https://docs.oracle.com.",Header for Page 267

column1: 269,12 Extensions for Oracle Accounting Hub
column2: Enterprise Scheduler Jobs for Oracle Accounting Hub
column3: Overview of Managing Job Definitions and Job Sets,"Users run scheduled processes based on jobs to process data and, in some cases, to provide report output.",Header for Page 269

column1: 269,12 Extensions for Oracle Accounting Hub
column2: Enterprise Scheduler Jobs for Oracle Accounting Hub
column3: Overview of Managing Job Definitions and Job Sets,"Each job has a job definition which, for example, determines the parameters that users can set. Jobs are based on Oracle Enterprise Scheduler Services. Using Enterprise Scheduler Jobs tasks, you can define job definitions, list of values sources, and job sets.",Header for Page 269

column1: 269,12 Extensions for Oracle Accounting Hub
column2: Enterprise Scheduler Jobs for Oracle Accounting Hub
column3: Overview of Managing Job Definitions and Job Sets,"Job Definitions : Contain the metadata about the job and the options available to users. A job definition is defined by a job type, such as Oracle Analytics Publisher or PL/SQL Job type or others.",Header for Page 269

column1: 269,12 Extensions for Oracle Accounting Hub
column2: Enterprise Scheduler Jobs for Oracle Accounting Hub
column3: Overview of Managing Job Definitions and Job Sets,List of Values Sources : Determine where a list of values for the parameters in a job definition comes from and what the specific values are.,Header for Page 269

column1: 269,12 Extensions for Oracle Accounting Hub
column2: Enterprise Scheduler Jobs for Oracle Accounting Hub
column3: Overview of Managing Job Definitions and Job Sets,Job Sets : Collections of several jobs in a single process set that the users submit instead of running separate jobs.,Header for Page 269

column1: 269,12 Extensions for Oracle Accounting Hub
column2: Enterprise Scheduler Jobs for Oracle Accounting Hub
column3: Overview of Managing Job Definitions and Job Sets,The various Enterprise Scheduler Jobs tasks are:,Header for Page 269

If you don't see the task, make sure that the Enterprise Scheduler Job Definitions and Job Sets feature is enabled at the offering level in the Offerings work area.",Header for Page 269

column1: 270,,Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials Implementing Accounting Hub,Header for Page 270
270,,Chapter 12 Extensions for Oracle Accounting Hub,Header for Page 270
270,,Manage List of Values Sources,Header for Page 270

270,Manage List of Values Sources,A list of values source for job definitions determines where a list of values comes from and what the specific values are. Users can select from the list when they set parameters.,Header for Page 270

270,Manage List of Values Sources,"For example, the list of values for a Country parameter gives users a list of countries to choose from. You can create list of values sources to use in job definitions that you or someone else created. Parameters in predefined job definitions can have lists of values too, but not from list of values sources that you can manage. But if you duplicate a predefined job definition, list of values sources might be automatically created for your new job definition. You can manage those sources as you would a source that you created yourself.",Header for Page 270
270,Manage List of Values Sources,"Here's how you get started to create, edit, or delete list of values sources:",Header for Page 270

270,Manage List of Values Sources,"1. In the Setup and Maintenance work area, go to the Manage Enterprise Scheduler Job Definitions and Job Sets task in the Application Extensions functional area. Or, depending on your offering, you might use a different functional area.",Header for Page 270
270,Manage List of Values Sources,"Note: If you don't see the task, make sure that the Enterprise Scheduler Job Definitions and Job Sets feature is enabled at the offering level.",Header for Page 270

270,Manage List of Values Sources,"2. Click the Manage List of Values Sources tab. If you dont see anything here, that just means you havent created any sources or duplicated any predefined job definitions that would result in automatically creating list of values sources. 3. Go on to create or edit list of values sources.",Header for Page 270
270,Manage List of Values Sources,Create List of Values Source,Header for Page 270
270,Manage List of Values Sources
column2: Create List of Values Source,Create a source based on predefined view objects or your own SQL query.,Header for Page 270

column1: 270,Manage List of Values Sources
column2: Create List of Values Source,"For predefined view objects, contact your help desk to find out if there are any that meet your needs. And to get the view object's full path, which you enter when creating the list of values source.",Header for Page 270

column1: 270,Manage List of Values Sources
column2: Create List of Values Source,"For your own SQL query, you can see the Tables and Views guides for more information, if you want to base the list of values source on a specific table or view.",Header for Page 270

column1: 270,Manage List of Values Sources
column2: Create List of Values Source,"Your list of values source might behave differently from similar sources used in predefined jobs. There are some limitations to creating custom sources. For example, you cant add new filtering criteria or configure the search.",Header for Page 270

column1: 270,Manage List of Values Sources
column2: Create List of Values Source,"1. On the Manage List of Values Sources tab, click the Create icon. 2. In the Create List of Values Source dialog box, select something from the Application Name list that's related to your list of values. If you don't know what to select or can't find anything that applies, just select Application Toolkit . 3. In the User List of Values Source Name field, enter a name that helps you identify your list of values source. 4. From the LOVType list, select Predefined to use a view object or User Defined to use a SQL query. 5. If you selected Predefined, then in the List of Values Source Definition Name field, enter the full path of the view object that your help desk provided.",Header for Page 270

column1: 270,Manage List of Values Sources
column2: Create List of Values Source,"If you selected User Defined, enter your own SQL in the Query field.",Header for Page 270

column1: 270,Manage List of Values Sources,"Your query can't have any aggregate function like DISTINCT, SUM, MAX, or AVG in the direct select clause. It can't have UNION, UNION ALL, INTERSECT, or MINUS either. If you absolutely need to use any of those functions, you need to wrap the query in another select clause. Here are a couple examples:",Header for Page 270
270,"Manage List of Values Sources

271,,6. Make sure everything looks fine and then click Save and Close . You can't change most of the things about your source after you create it.,Header for Page 271
271,,Edit or Delete List of Values Source,Header for Page 271

271,Edit or Delete List of Values Source,"Here are some things to know about editing and deleting list of values sources, which you can do on the Manage List of Values Sources tab.",Header for Page 271
271,Edit or Delete List of Values Source,You can edit only the application name and description.,Header for Page 271

271,Edit or Delete List of Values Source,"When you delete a list of values source, you can't find it and manage it any more, but it's not really gone. Any job definitions using that source can continue using it. So after you delete a source, you can't create another one later with the same name, even though you won't be able to find the deleted one. To avoid confusion, it's recommended that you don't ever delete any list of values source. Just create new ones as needed, with unique names.",Header for Page 271
